com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware

Interface I2cController

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HardwareDevice
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DeviceInterfaceModule, LegacyModule
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ModernRoboticsUsbDeviceInterfaceModule, ModernRoboticsUsbI2cController, ModernRoboticsUsbLegacyModule

    public interface I2cController
extends HardwareDevice
    Represents a device with several I2C ports. On the Legacy Module, each port is separate, but on the Device Interface Module all the ports are physically on the same bus, so be sure not to have conflicting I2C addresses on the DIM. All I2C interactions are asynchronous (meaning the user must request one to be performed and then handle the result at some other time). It is possible to read or write up to 26 contiguous registers at the same time. The read buffer contains what the controller most recently indicated its copy of the write buffer was.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  I2cController.I2cPortReadyBeginEndNotifications
      A callback interface through which a client can learn when portIsReady callbacks begin and then later end.
      static interface  I2cController.I2cPortReadyCallback
      Callback interface for I2C port ready notifications

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareDevice

    • Field Detail

      • I2C_BUFFER_START_ADDRESS

        static final byte I2C_BUFFER_START_ADDRESS
        The index in the read and write buffers where the data begins. Metadata is located before this index in the buffers.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getSerialNumber

        SerialNumber getSerialNumber()
        Gets the FTDI serial number of the module.
        Returns:
        the serial number (text version will look like "AL00VDDK")

      • enableI2cReadMode

        void enableI2cReadMode(int physicalPort,
                       I2cAddr i2cAddress,
                       int memAddress,
                       int length)
        Requests that the controller continually issue reads to certain registers on a certain I2C device
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - the port number on the controller
        i2cAddress - the I2C address of the device
        memAddress - the first register of the contiguous set to read
        length - the number of registers to read in a row

      • enableI2cWriteMode

        void enableI2cWriteMode(int physicalPort,
                        I2cAddr i2cAddress,
                        int memAddress,
                        int length)
        Requests that the controller issue a write the next time it can to certain registers on a certain I2C device
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - the port number on the controller
        i2cAddress - the I2C address of the device
        memAddress - the first register of the contiguous set to write to
        length - the number of registers to write to in a row

      • getCopyOfReadBuffer

        byte[] getCopyOfReadBuffer(int physicalPort)
        Gets an array containing precisely the last bytes read from the current read request. Overwriting values in this array doesn't affect the values stored by the controller. The value at index 0 is the result from the lowest register and so on.
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - the port number of the device on the controller

      • getCopyOfWriteBuffer

        byte[] getCopyOfWriteBuffer(int physicalPort)
        Gets an array containing precisely the last bytes requested to be written for the current write request. Overwriting values in this array doesn't affect the values stored by the controller. The value at index 0 is for the lowest register and so on.
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - the port number of the device on the controller

      • copyBufferIntoWriteBuffer

        void copyBufferIntoWriteBuffer(int physicalPort,
                               byte[] buffer)
        Sets the bytes to be written for the current write request
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - the port number of the device on the controller
        buffer - the values to write to the registers, starting at the lowest register

      • setI2cPortActionFlag

        void setI2cPortActionFlag(int port)
        Tells the controller to issue whatever request was asked of it
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller

      • clearI2cPortActionFlag

        void clearI2cPortActionFlag(int port)
        Tells the controller not to issue whatever request was asked of it. Essentially, undoes setI2cPortActionFlag(int).
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
        See Also:
        setI2cPortActionFlag(int)

      • isI2cPortActionFlagSet

        boolean isI2cPortActionFlagSet(int port)
        Returns whether setI2cPortActionFlag(int) was called more recently than clearI2cPortActionFlag(int) for a certain device
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
        Returns:
        whether the action will be performed

      • readI2cCacheFromController

        void readI2cCacheFromController(int port)
        Requests that the next values read from the controller are stored in this object. If this method isn't called, the read buffer will not be updated.
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller

      • writeI2cCacheToController

        void writeI2cCacheToController(int port)
        Requests that the current registers, read/write mode, and write data be sent to the controller. This should be called after readI2cCacheFromController(int) to avoid overwriting the data.
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller

      • writeI2cPortFlagOnlyToController

        void writeI2cPortFlagOnlyToController(int port)
        Writes only the value of the action flag to the controller
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
        See Also:
        setI2cPortActionFlag(int), writeI2cCacheToController(int)

      • isI2cPortInReadMode

        boolean isI2cPortInReadMode(int port)
        Gets whether the port is currently in read mode
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
        Returns:
        true iff the port was last set in read mode

      • isI2cPortInWriteMode

        boolean isI2cPortInWriteMode(int port)
        Gets whether the port is currently in write mode
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
        Returns:
        true iff the port was last set in write mode

      • isI2cPortReady

        boolean isI2cPortReady(int port)
        Gets whether the last request to the port has been completed.
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
        Returns:
        true iff the port is ready for another request

      • getI2cReadCacheLock

        java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock getI2cReadCacheLock(int port)
        Gets a lock on the read buffer so it can be directly read from. By lock()ing the lock, you can be guaranteed that nothing else will change the contents of the buffer before you unlock it. It is generally easier to simply call getCopyOfReadBuffer(int).
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
        Returns:
        an object which allows you to gain temporary unique access to the read buffer

      • getI2cWriteCacheLock

        java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock getI2cWriteCacheLock(int port)
        Gets a lock on the write buffer so it can be directly written to. By lock()ing the lock, you can be guaranteed that nothing else will change the contents of the buffer or read from the buffer before you unlock it. It is generally easier to simply call copyBufferIntoWriteBuffer(int, byte[]) or getCopyOfWriteBuffer(int).
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
        Returns:
        an object which allows you to gain temporary unique access to the write buffer

      • getI2cReadCache

        byte[] getI2cReadCache(int port)
        Gets a reference to the read buffer that won't change for the controller object. The format is as follows:
        • Byte 0: indicates either read or write
        • Byte 1: the 8-bit I2C address of the device
        • Byte 2: the lowest register in the contiguous set
        • Byte 3: the number of registers in the contiguous set
        • Bytes 4-30: the data
        • Byte 31: the action flag
        You should lock the buffer before using it.
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
        Returns:
        a reference to the read buffer

      • getI2cWriteCache

        byte[] getI2cWriteCache(int port)
        Gets a reference to the write buffer that won't change for the controller object. The format is as follows:
        • Byte 0: indicates either read or write
        • Byte 1: the 8-bit I2C address of the device
        • Byte 2: the lowest register in the contiguous set
        • Byte 3: the number of registers in the contiguous set
        • Bytes 4-30: the data
        • Byte 31: the action flag
        You should lock the buffer before using it.
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
        Returns:
        a reference to the write buffer

      • registerForI2cPortReadyCallback

        void registerForI2cPortReadyCallback(I2cController.I2cPortReadyCallback callback,
                                     int port)
        Indicates what method to run when each request finishes. Only one callback can be set at a time for a single port.
        Parameters:
        callback - the method to run (or, if null, indicates that no method should be run)
        port - the port number of the device on the controller

      • getI2cPortReadyCallback

        I2cController.I2cPortReadyCallback getI2cPortReadyCallback(int port)
        Gets the last-set ready callback
        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
        Returns:
        the callback
        See Also:
        registerForI2cPortReadyCallback(I2cPortReadyCallback, int)

      • deregisterForPortReadyCallback

        void deregisterForPortReadyCallback(int port)

        Parameters:
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
        See Also:
        registerForI2cPortReadyCallback(I2cPortReadyCallback, int)

      • registerForPortReadyBeginEndCallback

        void registerForPortReadyBeginEndCallback(I2cController.I2cPortReadyBeginEndNotifications callback,
                                          int port)
        Indicates what method to run when all a port is ready before and after the read callback is called
        Parameters:
        callback - the method to run
        port - the port number of the device on the controller
